title: Honor Magic8 Lite launches in the UK with a discount, free watch and charger
description: When the Honor Magic8 Lite was announced a month ago, the company said that it will reveal the price in January – well, it’s January now and Honor UK has delivered. The other European branches are oddly silent, though. Honor Magic8 Lite in Reddish Brown, Forest Green and Midnight Black Here’s the Honor Magic8 Lite (8/512GB) on Honor UK. The normal price is £400, but you can claim a £50 voucher to discount the price. If you order now, you will also score a couple of freebies: an Honor Choice Watch 2 Pro and an Honor SuperCharge Power Adapter 2 (66W). Note that this is while...

title: Poco M8 in for review
description: This is the brand-new Poco M8, and it’s the latest entry in the storied M-series. Our review unit is waiting for its unboxing, so let’s not make it wait any longer. Poco devices are usually well-equipped in these slim-box and no accessory times, and the M8 is no different. The M8 comes bundled with a grey silicone case, a 45W power adapter and a USB-C cable. The EU market will likely not have the charger bundled. We have the Green colored variant with us, which features a matte dual-tone approach to its back and a nice textured finish on the sides. The M8 gets IP66 dust and...

title: Poco M8 Pro review
Oppo Reno15 series, Pad 5 and Enco Buds3 Pro+ officially launch in India, here are the prices
description: Most of the Oppo Reno15 phones already had their international debut, except for the Oppo Reno15 Pro Mini. During an official launch event in India, the company introduced the handset alongside the vanilla Reno15, the standard Reno15 Pro and the Reno 15c. The Oppo Pad 5 and the Enco Buds3 Pro+ also tagged along, and here are all the prices for the Indian market. Oppo Reno15 series Let's start with the Oppo Reno15 Pro, which starts at INR 67,999 for the 12GB/256GB variant, while the 12GB/512GB version is asking INR 72,999. The handset is offered in just two color options - Sunset Gold...

title: Poco M8 Pro 5G and Poco M8 5G announced
description: Poco has finally unveiled the new M8 5G series, which includes the Poco M8 and the Poco M8 Pro. The latest M series phones come equipped with Snapdragon chipsets. Poco M8 5G The Poco M8 is powered by the Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 SoC, paired with up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 512GB of UFS 2.2 internal storage. It runs Android 15-based HyperOS 2 and offers a bunch of AI features such as Google Gemini, Circle to Search, and others. It sports a 6.77-inch AMOLED display with a refresh rate of 120Hz, up to 3,200 nits peak brightness, 3,840Hz PWM dimming, 12-bit color depth, and Full-HD+...

title: Oppo Reno15 Pro Mini goes official with a 200MP camera and Dimensity 8450
description: Some of the Oppo Reno15 family members already entered the global stage, but one of the new additions to the series, the Reno15 Pro Mini, remained under wraps until today. The company officially launched the Oppo Reno15, Reno15 Pro, Reno15c and the Reno15 Pro Mini at a launch event in India today. The Mini, as the name implies, features a somewhat small 6.32-inch OLED panel with a 120Hz refresh rate and FHD+ resolution. The handset relies on a MediaTek Dimensity 8450 chipset paired with 12GB RAM and 256GB storage or 12GB RAM with 512GB storage. Despite its size, the Mini gets a...

title: RayNeo Air 4 Pro AR glasses with HDR10 support go global
description: The RayNeo Air 4 Pro AR glasses, which were unveiled in China last year, have now made their global debut at CES 2026. The TCL-backed brand showcased the Air 4 Pro and an eSIM version of the RayNeo X3 Pro at the event. RayNeo Air 4 Pro is being touted as the world’s first HDR10-enabled AR glasses. The glasses feature 0.6-inch Micro-OLED displays with up to 120Hz refresh rate, 3,840Hz PWM hybrid dimming, and 1,200 nits brightness. The Air 4 Pro offers up to a 201-inch virtual screen at 6m distance with 10-level brightness adjustment and a 200,000:1 contrast ratio. It is equipped...

title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Health with Apple Health and MyFitnessPal integration
description: OpenAI is launching ChatGPT Health, which is a special place within ChatGPT where you can connect your Apple Health, MyFitnessPal, Function, Weight Watchers, AllTrails, Instacart, and Peloton accounts and ask questions about your health. OpenAI says ChatGPT is "designed in close collaboration with physicians" to "help people take a more active role in understanding and managing their health and wellness". And use ChatGPT more. Based on "de-identified analysis of conversations", OpenAI knows that over 230 million people across the globe already ask ChatGPT about health and wellness, and...

title: OnePlus reveals the Turbo 6V's main specs ahead of its imminent announcement
description: OnePlus is unveiling the Turbo 6 and Turbo 6V in just a few hours. While the company already teased the Turbo 6's main specs a few days ago, it waited until today to do the same for the Turbo 6V, the cheapest of the duo. Even though it will be the more affordable model, it shares the same 9,000 mAh battery with the Turbo 6. The Turbo 6V is powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 4 SoC, and its screen has 144Hz refresh rate (the Turbo 6's goes up to 165Hz). OnePlus Turbo 6V specs The Turbo 6V's battery charges at up to 80W via wires, and it also supports 27W reverse wired charging...

title: Watch the Poco M8 and Poco M8 Pro official announcement live here
description: After a lot of teasing, rumors, and leaks, the Poco M8 and Poco M8 Pro are finally about to become official, and the brand has a live stream up already for the grand unveiling - it's embedded below for your viewing pleasure. The launch event starts on January 8 at 16:00 in China, which is 13:30 in India, 8:00 in the UK, and 9:00 in Central Europe. The Poco M8 is already officially confirmed to come with a 6.77-inch 3D curved OLED screen with 1080x2392 resolution, 120Hz refresh rate, and 3,200-nit peak brightness, the Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 SoC at the helm, 8GB of RAM, a 50MP main rear...

title: Oppo Reno15 series prices in India leak
description: Oppo recently launched the Reno15 series globally, and the Indian announcement is expected on January 8. Ahead of that, the purported recommended retail prices for the devices in India have been leaked today. Let's take a look. The vanilla Reno15 8/256GB will apparently go for INR 45,999, the 12/256GB model for INR 48,999, and the 12/512GB version for INR 53,999. Moving over to the Reno15 Pro Mini, which will seemingly make its international debut in India, this one will start at INR 59,999 in its 12/256GB version. If you want the 12/512GB model, you'll have to pay INR 64,999. Oppo...

title: Spotify now lets you share what you're listening to with your friends in real time
description: Spotify now lets you display what you're listening to inside Messages in real time. This is called Listening activity and it's opt-in, so it's turned off by default. If you're not actively listening, your most recent song will be shown instead. This is visible only to friends and family you've already connected with inside Messages on Spotify. You can see others' activity even if you haven't turned your own listening activity on, provided they have opted in. To turn this on, go to the Privacy and social settings inside the Spotify app. Once enabled, activity appears in...

title: Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold hands-on
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold is very exclusive and will likely remain like that - it's on sale in South Korea, China, Taiwan, Singapore, and the UAE, and is expected to arrive Stateside soon. But we managed to spend some time with one at this year's CES and we have some early thoughts to share. Compared to modern phones, especially recent ones, it's quite the brick when folded. There's no getting around that - having two folding sides and one middle one means the Galaxy Z TriFold will be a fat gadget when fully closed. However, it's not unmanageably thick, and people who'll buy...

title: WhatsApp adds three new features to group chats
description: WhatsApp is 'leveling up' your group chats today with three new features. With Member tags, you can give yourself a tag to tell the group what your role is. This can be different for each group you're in. Next up, text stickers. Any word can now be turned into a sticker by simply typing your text into Sticker Search. Newly created stickers can also be added directly to your sticker packs instead of having to send them in a chat first. Finally, event reminders are rather self-explanatory. When you create and send an event in a group chat, you can set custom early reminders for those...

title: Samsung patent shows flip phone with a 360-degree hinge
description: A new Samsung patent gives us our first look at a flip-style foldable, which folds both inward and outward. The patent was spotted on the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) database and is accompanied by sketches for the flip-style device with a 360-degree hinge. Unlike mainstream flip-style folds, the device in the patent listing does not have a dedicated cover screen. The sketches show that the folding screen can fold outward, wrapping around the back of the device, but it can also fold inward. This approach would require a complex hinge mechanism that would support...

title: Redmi Turbo 5 Max might have just been shown in new renders
description: The Redmi Turbo 5 series contains the Redmi Turbo 5 Max, the brand has officially announced earlier this month. The Max suffix is new to this line, which previously only had vanilla and Pro models. Now the Redmi Turbo 5 Max has allegedly been pictured in the renders you can see below, which you should take with a hefty dose of salt since they look like they're AI-generated and we can't vouch for the source. Purported Redmi Turbo 5 Max renders If this design is accurate, it looks like Redmi is going for a rather different look compared to the Turbo 4 and Turbo 4 Pro. The...

title: Dreame enters wearables market with AI and ECG-enabled smart rings
description: Dreame Technology, the China-based smart home appliance brand, has entered the wearables market with the introduction of its first AI-powered smart and health rings. The company showcased the new lineup at CES 2026, unveiling three models. The lineup consists of the AI Smart Ring, an AI Health Ring with ECG, and the AI Health Ring with NFC. Dreame promises each of those will offer about a week of battery life. Dreame AI Health Ring with NFC and AI Smart Ring. The AI Smart Ring features comprehensive health tracking, including heart rate, SpO2, skin temperature, HRV insights, sleep...

title: Samsung execs warn of upcoming phone price hikes over memory shortages
description: Co-CEO of Samsung’s mobile division, TM Roh, spoke to the media at the CES 2026 trade show, saying “We’re facing one of the harshest pricing situations in memory” and warning that “smartphone price adjustments may be necessary”. Samsung is working with other companies in its supply chain to try and deal with the situation in the long term as all kinds of electronics are affected by this – notably smartphones, but also TVs and other smart devices. Samsung’s Global Marketing Head Wonjin Lee told Bloomberg that the company is considering “repricing” its phones to match the new economic...

title: Here's how much the Motorola Signature will cost in the UK and the Eurozone
description: Motorola unveiled the Signature earlier today as its newest flagship smartphone. Unfortunately, the company didn't share pricing at that time, but now the Signature is listed on Motorola's websites for the UK and Germany, and it does thankfully come with a price in both places: £899.99 / €999. This amount gets you the device with 12GB of RAM and 512GB of storage, the only option that's been listed. It will be available in Pantone Carbon and Pantone Martini Olive. You can't even pre-order the phone yet, however, all you can do right now is register your interest in it and Motorola will...

title: Report: Realme is going back to sub-brand status under Oppo
description: The latest restructuring inside the ranks of the former BBK Electronics conglomerate involves Realme’s return as an Oppo sub-brand. The news comes from China’s Leifeng.com and is based on information shared by internal sources from Oppo. According to the report, Realme founder and CEO Sky Li will retain his responsibilities and will lead the Realme sub-brand under Oppo management in this organizational alignment. According to the report, Oppo is looking to strengthen internal collaboration between Oppo, Realme and fellow sub-brand OnePlus while also improving resource management and...
